content: Acquisition.com is a family office that invests its own money into companies, with 10 portfolio companies generating over $250,000,000+ per year.
Alex Hormozi sold 66% of Gym Launch & Prestige Labs for $46.2M in an all-cash deal to American Pacific Group when he was 31 years old.
Alex Hormozi started Acquisition.com at 31 years old, investing and scaling companies using $42M in distributions and cash from the $46.2M exit.
Alex Hormozi became co-owner of Skool.com, a platform for building online communities, at 34 years old.
Alex Hormozi achieved a $106M book launch, selling 3.6M copies of his $100M Money Models book in 72 hours, setting a Guinness world record for the fastest-selling non-fiction book.
The Acquisition.com portfolio currently generates $200M/year across 10 companies, with individual company revenues ranging from $5M to $100M per year.
Winning can be defined as either achieving an epic outcome or having an epic story, especially when facing significant challenges.
